reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel met all our requirements of location, service and view. We lived in small cosy room. Hotel transfer met us in airport despite night time and brought us comfortably to hotel. All personnel was very polite and helpful. Additional thanks to Murat Cone who kindly helped us with booking. The very best remarkable thing about Lady Diana Hotel is perfect view from the roof restaurant and bar. Every day that we started in this restaurant having breakfast was perfect. From there you can see Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, and Marmara Sea. So, living in this hotel you are in old center of Istanbul.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for romantic stay

reviews.text: I had the priveledge of staying at this hotel in July 2009 with my 16 yr old daughter. We had no idea what to expect but what we found was a hotel that was just perect for the two of us. The staff was extremely helpful and arranged our tour of Ephesus. It is located in the heart of the Old City and close to all major historical sites. The breakfast was an absolute treat and overlooked The Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya. I noticed that other reviewers complained about the room size. I am not sure what else one would expect in Europe. We loved our room and bathroom. We didn't have a great view but that wasn't important to us. The AC worked really well. The beds were comfortable and the shower was the largest that we had seen on our 2 week trip. Free WiFi was available in all of the rooms which was an important feature for us as we had our own computer. There was also a computer available in the lobby. This hotel is a good value for the money. If I am ever in Istanbul again I will definitely stay at The Lady Diana again.
reviews.title: We loved this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If location is your priority, then by all means stay at this hotel. However, don't expect a nice room. Ours was so small you could not even lay a suitcase open. No view, dark and dingy. Also, be prepared for them to tell you they have to move you to their "sister" hotel. I had heard they do this and it happened to us. When our friends arrived they were told the hotel was overbooked and were moved to a slightly lesser quality hotel. We were told there was a problem with the AC. I, however, did not buy their story and insisted we stay. They checked us in, but gave us a pretty lousy room.
reviews.title: Great location and the hotel itself is nice, the room we had was pretty bad.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was average, clean and tidy and probably the best you will find in the area, This is the area to stay as handy to most of the main attractions and in walking distance. If you want the nice 5 star resorts they are all over on the other side of town and just not handy. That's the sort of places we usually stay so we are a bit bias with 3 or 4 star accom. You spend little time in your room as there is so much to see in the area. Rooms are smallish but not to bad, Ask for a quite room, we got a corner room and got no noise, Aircon was ok, not to noisey. You have to keep windows closed at night as the mosques make quite a lot of noise every 4 hours or so. Take ear plugs, really helps. Don't rely on the reasturant, meals as they are pretty basic and after one main it's time to look elsewhere. I dont think the chef has a clue quite frankly. All the staff stand around gauking at you while eatiing, quite off putting. Use the resturant and outside decks for your coffees, nice setting and views. I'd stay here again as there is no choice but if there was a Sheraton etc next door you would'nt see me for dust. Ps they will also pick you up at airport for no cost. Good for peace of mind.
reviews.title: Handy spot, serves the purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location close to Blu Mosque and the old part of the city. Fantastic view from the resteurant deck. Great hospitality. Room was not large enough but for 3 days it was ok.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like other reviewers, this location is excellent - I went everywhere from this hotel. This city is very friendly and perfect for the diy traveler. The hotel is in a safe location (sometimes I went shopping without my husband and still felt really safe). It's tucked away from the busy streets but still steps away. The buffet breakfast was very good too!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Great Value

reviews.text: The location of this hotel couldn't be better, the pictures of the views from the roof terrace are exactly as it is, it was unbelievable and a lovely place to eat breakfast every morning. Although I had read that the rooms were small, this was not our experience. There were three of us girls sharing and there was adequate space for us and all our stuff!! The hotel is clean and welcoming, the breakfast is good and varied and served till 10am if you're a late riser! The restaurant is also open 24 hours and very reasonable. Although we were a little worried about how close we were to the Blue Mosque and the very early call to prayer, the insulation was good enough for us not to hear it.
reviews.title: amazing location, great hotel

reviews.text: The service in the hotel was very good and there is a shop next door which sells water, snacks etc - very handy. we had a really good experience.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location, great Staff

reviews.text: 2 nights in Lady Diana were not enough to explore the city so I may have to return. Would not hesitate to return to this hotel. Great value, very clean and the staff are very polite. The room was small but decent and squeaky clean. Breakfast is great, the restaurant on the top has a great view. Located near major landmarks. Definitely recomended.
reviews.title: Very good view from upper-floor and 5* location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its very clean, modern hotel in the center of historical Sultanahmet. We have been at the conference with my collegues and we happy that stay in Lady Diana not in Movenpick as other people who come for conference. Cose Lady Diana is at the center...everything is near....not far from the hotel great resautrane Boukoleon with fantastic view to Bosfor...we found it on small Istanbul street during our working in Sultanahmet...but we really suprised (cheep price - great service and food).
reviews.title: Convenient location with helpful staff

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week and it was great. The restaurant on the roof has an amazing view over the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Granted this hotel is not new or spacious, the bathrooms could use a bit of bleach to get rid of some of the mold and the towels were a bit worn. But for the price, you can't get a better location than this hotel. The breakfast was plentiful, and although I wouldn't call it great, I certainly got enough to eat. I thought the room was typical of what you see in this part of the world. We stayed there for two nights prior to a cruise. When it was all said and done, I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent location for the price.

reviews.text: An extremely nice hotel beautifully clean with many adavntages , Sauna, turkish bath, fitness suite and it has very helpful and polite staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The Top Floor restaurant has incredible views over the City and the food was superb.
reviews.title: Recommandable

reviews.text: The location is could ,nt be better, being within a few minutes walk of all the important sites in Istanbul .
reviews.title: My stay at Lady Daiana Hotel - Istanbul

reviews.text: I've been to many hotels and regardless of the negative reviews seen here, YOU WILL LOVE THIS HOTEL. In addition to its fabulous location & good food--you will not mind your small room when you have your first breakfast on the rooftop and soak up the magnificent views! Hagia Sofya, Blue Mosque, & Bosphorus strait will greet & delight you each morning. In the evening, end your day with their wonderful Efes beer and a plate of hummus back on the rooftop where the mosques are fully lit and make for a perfect ending to your day. Bathrooms have nice water pressure for showers but are very small--I recommend bringing a hanging toiletry bag as there is limited shelf space. This hotel also has its own Turkish Bath (hamman) and I found the Foaming Turkish Bath (without the scrubbing) to be absolutely sublime! Also, free internet in lobby made it easy to check in at home...And you can walk to almost everything!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Expecting a four star hotel I was severly disappointed with the Lady Diana Hotel. Decor in the rooms was some of the ugliest I have seen, it felt like a 3 star budget hotel but is priced like a 4 star. Bathrooms are miniscule with a shower in a half-sized bathtub. Suites were bigger but equally as ugly. I am sure there are far better options for the same money. When we first arrived having booked a superior double we were put in the smallest hotel room I have ever seen (and we travel a lot!!) with only enough room for one person to shuffle round the bed and nowhere to put your bags - we were moved after complaining but overall the experience at the hotel was a disappointment.
reviews.title: Not 4 Star - rooftop terrace is the only good thing about it
The only downside to our holiday was this so called "4*" hotel!!!!
reviews.text: The wife and I booked a room for two with a double bed - upon arrival we were shown a tiny room with two single beds! we went down to reception to say there must be some mistake but were told by the very unhelpful receptionist (Ali Rezza) that all other rooms are booked and that they'll move us tomorrow!!

The rooms in this hotel are fairly tacky and bathrooms not maintained! the drain in the bath-tub was blocked and caused the water to rise! when they came with a plunger all sorts of filth seemed to be blocking the drain! the mildew build up and tiles that have turned yellow made us cringe!! the shower curtains were also falling apart and had turned a nasty yellow colour.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was also poor - nothing breakfast about it!!
reviews.title: What an unbelievable hassle
